description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此

透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Freshman English for Non-English Majors (Lower-Intermediate, Fall 2017)**

**8:10-10:00, Friday**

Instructor: Hsu Hsiao-Ling
--------------------------

Email: [hlhsu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:hlhsu@ntnu.edu.tw)
----------------------------------------------------

Office: Common Core Education Committee, 3rd floor Administrative Building

Office Hours: By appointment (Monday 13:00~15:00; Friday 13:00~15:00)

**Course Description:**

This general English course is designed to enhance students’ reading, writing, listening and speaking skills. Students will be offered the opportunity to develop these 4 language skills along with critical thinking skills by presenting them with ideas from all over the world.

**Textbook**:

Stephenson, H. Lansford, L. & Dummett, P. (2016). _Keynote 4_. Boston, MA: Cengage Learning Publisher.

(Available at 師大書苑; 02-83695556~8;台北市和平東路1段182-3號2樓)

**Articles for required reading:**

Talk 1: How to make stress your friend. 

Talk 2: How movies teach manhood.

Talk 5: How I held my breath for 17 minutes.

**Grading Policy:**

Attendance & Participation                                   10%

Video Presentation (pair work)\*1                          10% (select a date)

Dialogue presentation (pair work)\*2                     10%

Language exchange presentation\*1                       10%

(group work)

Discussion (group work)\*3                                    15%

Assignments (individual)\*3                                   15%

Quiz (individual)\*3                                                        15%

Lexile book play (group work)                              15%

**Attendance and Participation (individual work)**

Punctual attendance and active participation are required. If you are habitually late or absent, points will be deducted and you may fail this course. If you have to miss a class, please inform me in advance. Participation also includes teamwork and group projects. 

**Video Presentation (pair work)**

\--Select a date you like to present after Week 6.

\-A selection of a video for your classmates. You can choose any topic you like, but be aware if it is suitable to play them in the public. (5~10 min)

\-In this video presentation, you need to 1) select 5 words and introduce the 5 words together with some practice for your classmates and 2) select a passage in the video and explain why you enjoy it.

**Dialogue presentation (pair work)**

You will receive instructions on dialogue lines in class for all three required Talk. In each Talk, you can volunteer to present your original dialogues in front of the class. Two of your dialogue presentations account for 20% of your total score.

**Discussion (group work)**

\-In each Talk, you are required to do group discussion, record your discussion, and upload to the Moodle.

\-Scores will be given based on the quality of your discussion, that is, meaningful interaction.

**Assignment (individual work)**

\-In each Talk, you are required to turn in writing assignments for each reading. For example, you read page 30 to 31 in Talk 2 and turn in the writing assignment based on your reading.

\-You will need to write (**paraphrase**) the thesis statement and the controlling ideas of the assigned reading. No point will be given if you copy directly from the textbook.

\-You will need to turn in a **Hard Copy** of your assignment when the instructor announce it. No late work is accepted only if there are reasonable excuses.

\-Writing assignment sample is downloadable on the Moodle.

**Lexile (individual score, group work)**

        -You will receive a test on Week 5 or 6 in class time in a computer lab and receive a test score.

        -I will note down your scores immediately.

\-Students of similar scores will be grouped together and make two selection of Lexile books of common interest. For example, if one score 200, then you can read books ranging from 100~250.

\-Your group have to write a play based on the books.

\-You will need to perform it in front of the class.

\-Your play will last about 10 min.
